sentence.Network_en: Katherine McCormack goes beyond horoscopes and provides a quick guide to other forms of divination.
sentence.Network_cn: 凯瑟琳?麦考马克超越了占星并给其它形式的预言提供了快速的指导.

sentence.Network_en: Divination is made up of a little error and superstition, plus a lot of fraud.
sentence.Network_cn: 占卜是由一些谬误和迷信构成, 再加上大量的欺骗.

sentence.Network_en: Will time turners or divination come into play in some way again?
sentence.Network_cn: 也许时间转换器和占卜术又以某种方式发生了作用?

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin divinatio(n-), from divinare 'predict' (see divine)

entry.def: Divination is the art or practice of discovering what will happen in the future using supernatural means.

means.word_mean: 1. successful conjecture by unusual insight or good luck
2. a prediction uttered under divine inspiration
3. the art or gift of prophecy (or the pretense of prophecy) by supernatural means
